Ad Text:
Senior Machine Learning Engineer
Initial 6-Month Contract
Surry Hills, Sydney - Hybrid Work Model

About the Role
The Data and Insights Branch is seeking an experienced Senior Machine Learning Engineer to lead the design, development, and deployment of advanced AI and machine learning solutions that support our agency's strategic goals. This pivotal role will drive data-driven decision-making and deliver innovative, ethical AI capabilities within a secure, compliant environment.

As an EL1 ML Engineer, you will provide technical leadership, collaborate with DVA data professionals, and ensure the implementation of robust, scalable, and responsible machine learning solutions across the organisation. Initially, you will focus on understanding and leveraging the GovAI platform and the existing AWS DVA/Services Australia environment, with a key role in supporting DVA's Cloud Roadmap.

Eligibility Criteria

Australian Citizen
Ability to obtain and maintain a minimum Baseline security clearance

Key Responsibilities

Design and develop machine learning models and algorithms for complex datasets
Build and maintain end-to-end ML pipelines for training, testing, and deployment
Optimize models for performance, scalability, and accuracy in production settings
Collaborate with data scientists, engineers, and stakeholders to translate requirements into technical solutions
Ensure compliance with Australian Government security frameworks (ISM, PSPF) and uphold ethical AI principles
Implement monitoring and maintenance processes, including data drift detection and model lifecycle management
Provide technical guidance, mentorship, and capability development within the team
Stay informed of emerging ML technologies and industry best practices

Essential Skills & Experience

Proven experience in machine learning engineering within complex environments
Proficiency in Python and ML frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn
Strong background in data engineering, feature engineering, and model optimization
Experience with ML Ops tools and practices (Kubeflow, MLflow, Airflow)
Hands-on experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP) and containerization (Docker, Kubernetes)
Excellent problem-solving skills, with the ability to manage multiple priorities
Strong communication skills and ability to engage stakeholders effectively

Join Us
If you're passionate about leveraging AI to make a meaningful impact and meet the above criteria, we want to hear from you!

How to Apply:
Please submit your CV and cover letter in Word format by clicking the "APPLY NOW" button below or email your application to anna.au@talentinternational.com.
